title.narrative: SI2-SOCIAL PROTECTION FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2021, the most vulnerable children, women, adolescents and young people have access to coherent social protection services., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Evaluation, Reducing Child Poverty, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 Children's rights are better documented, and the Government uses these records to inform, cost and implement inclusive social policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the most vulnerable children, women, adolescents and young people have access to coherent social protection services.

description.narrative: L’UNICEF a contribué au dialogue et à la coordination de la protection sociale par le biais de contacts directs avec des ministères clés, des agences des Nations Unies et des bailleurs. Les efforts se sont concentrés sur le positionnement stratégique de l&39;UNICEF comme acteur et partenaire clé de la protection sociale en raison de sa capacité à faciliter des processus multipartites et des mécanismes de coordination tels que le Comité de Coordination du Secteur Protection Sociale et Filets Sociaux (CCSPSFS), créé en 2021, présidé par le ministère du Travail, de l&39;Emploi et de la Protection Sociale et co-présidé par l&39;UNICEF. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/01/2022
